detaileddescription.para: Assert string equality
Assert memory equality

parameterdescription.para: Size of the memory to compare

detaileddescription.para: Assert signed integer equality
Assert unsigned integer equality
Assert hexadecimal integer equality
Assert pointer equality
Assert signed integer equality with margin

parameterdescription.para: Allowed margin to be applied during assertion

memberdef.name: TEST_ASSERT_EQUAL_WITH_MARGIN
memberdef.initializer: do { \ long __margin = margin; \ if (margin < 0) __margin = -margin; \ if( expected > actual ) { \ if( (expected - actual) <= __margin ) {} \ else {assertImplementationInt(expected,actual,10,__LINE__,__FILE__);} \ } \ else { \ if( (actual - expected) <= __margin ) {} \ else {assertImplementationInt(expected,actual,10,__LINE__,__FILE__);} \ } \ } while(0)

detaileddescription.para: Assert signed integer equality with margin

parameterdescription.para: Allowed margin to be applied during assertion

memberdef.name: TEST_ASSERT_EQUAL_UINT_WITH_MARGIN
memberdef.initializer: do { \ unsigned long __margin = margin; \ if( expected > actual ) { \ if( (expected - actual) <= __margin ) {} \ else {assertImplementationUInt(expected,actual,10,__LINE__,__FILE__);} \ } \ else { \ if( (actual - expected) <= __margin ) {} \ else {assertImplementationUInt(expected,actual,10,__LINE__,__FILE__);} \ } \ } while(0)

detaileddescription.para: Assert unsigned integer equality with margin

parameterdescription.para: Allowed margin to be applied during assertion

detaileddescription.para: Assert signed integer to be higher than or equal to a minimum value
Assert signed integer to be lower than or equal to a maximum value

memberdef.name: TEST_ASSERT_RANGE_INT
memberdef.initializer: do { \ TEST_ASSERT_NOT_LOWER_THAN_INT(min, actual)\ TEST_ASSERT_NOT_HIGHER_THAN_INT(max, actual)\ } while(0)

detaileddescription.para: Assert signed integer to be within the range (boundaries are allowed) of given minimum and maximum
Assert unsigned integer to be higher than or equal to a minimum value
Assert unsigned integer to be lower than or equal to a maximum value

memberdef.name: TEST_ASSERT_RANGE_UINT
memberdef.initializer: do { \ TEST_ASSERT_NOT_LOWER_THAN_UINT(min, actual)\ TEST_ASSERT_NOT_HIGHER_THAN_UINT(max, actual)\ } while(0)

detaileddescription.para: Assert unsigned integer to be within the range (boundaries are allowed) of given minimum and maximum
Assert a pointer to be NULL
Assert a pointer to be non-NULL
Assert a condition to pass

parameterdescription.para: Message to print when assertion fails

detaileddescription.para: Assert a condition to pass
Mark a test as failed

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *msg, unsigned long line, const char *file)
memberdef.name: addFailure

memberdef.argsstring: (long expected, long actual, unsigned char base, unsigned long line, const char *file)
memberdef.name: assertImplementationInt

detaileddescription.para: Implementation for failing assert for integers

The given set of parameters is used to add a failure
expected
The expected value for the assert
actual
The actual value for the assert
base
The base in which to print a failure (10 for decimal, 16 for hex)
line
Line number on which the assertion is done
file
File name in which the assertion is done

memberdef.argsstring: (unsigned long expected, unsigned long actual, unsigned char base, unsigned long line, const char *file)
memberdef.name: assertImplementationUInt

detaileddescription.para: Implementation for failing assert for unsigned integers

The given set of parameters is used to add a failure
expected
The expected value for the assert
actual
The actual value for the assert
base
The base in which to print a failure (10 for decimal, 16 for hex)
line
Line number on which the assertion is done
file
File name in which the assertion is done

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *expected, const char *actual, unsigned long line, const char *file)
memberdef.name: assertImplementationCStr

detaileddescription.para: Implementation for failing assert for string

The given set of parameters is used to add a failure
expected
The expected string for the assert
actual
The actual string for the assert
line
Line number on which the assertion is done
file
File name in which the assertion is done

memberdef.argsstring: (const void *expected, const void *actual, int size, unsigned long line, const char *file)
memberdef.name: assertImplementationMem

detaileddescription.para: Implementation for failing assert for memory

The given set of parameters is used to add a failure
exp
The expected memory for the assert
act
The actual memory for the assert
size
The size of the memory for the assert
line
Line number on which the assertion is done
file
File name in which the assertion is done
